full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 67 of 261 1207 LC6VMAX2 Kate - direct 1 A. I asked to testify under a pseudonym because I have a child. And I do not wish for her to be associated with or exposed to any negative connotation that this might bring. 2 Q. You testified earlier that you first spoke with the government in August 2019. About how many meetings have you had with the government since that time? 3 A. About ten meetings. 4 Q. What is your immigration status? 5 A. I am in status in this country on an O-1 visa. 6 Q. And what is that? 7 A. It's a visa of extraordinary ability. 8 Q. What does that mean? 9 A. It can be extraordinary ability in many different areas. Initially, I was a singer/songwriter, but it extends to any artist. 10 Q. Did there come a time when you asked the government to sponsor you for a visa? 11 A. Yes. 12 Q. At the time you made the request, approximately how many meetings had you had with the government? 13 A. Approximately seven. 14 Q. Approximately how long had you been meeting with the government at the time you raised your immigration status? 15 A. About a year and a half. 16 Q. Has the government made any promises to you about your SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012818
